file_content.text: You have my judgment. Return to your master and let me rest.
Excellent. These former acolytes wanted nothing more than to earn their second chance for glory by killing you and taking your place.
But your desire proved stronger, and their blood became the mantle of your victory. Well done--but you are not Sith yet.
You will need your wits, and your passion, and you will need to shed far more blood than this to become Sith.
I have wits and passion to spare.
No problem.
Do not let your confidence become complacency. You must always be hungry for power.
So was that the test? Did I pass?
Did I do it right?
That is only part of the test.
Don't waste my time.
The point is to learn the ways of the Sith, young acolyte.
Peace is a lie, there is only passion. Through passion, I gain strength. Through strength, power. Through power, victory. Through victory, my chains are broken.
This is the Sith Code. Commit it to your heart, and you will have the strength to crush your enemies. Do you understand?
Yes, I think I do. I must use my emotions to grow strong.
Maybe....
Do not be timid. Humility is the attitude of a slave, not a Sith. Now go.
Of course! I was born to be Sith!
Absolutely!
Good. Then go.
There is nothing that you can teach me that I don't already know, old man.
Shut up already.
There is nothing you can teach me that I don't already know, old man.
Shut up already.
Then leave.
Return to Harkun and nurture your hatred for him. And use your fear of him to grow stronger.
He may raise his fist to strike, but it is Lord Zash who determines where the blow will land.
How do you know Harkun and Lord Zash?
Wait--you know them?
Both of them have been through here in my time, and they have gone their separate paths since.
But who controls Zash, I wonder?
What about Lord Zash?
When you know the answer to that, you will have power over both your masters.
And what if she tells him to strike me?
I just hope it's not me.
If you do not already know the answer to that question, then you are not worthy of being Sith.
Now go! Leave me to my rest.
I will speak with you no more until you have slain these mad acolytes of mine.
Ah, an alien acolyte. Unusual, but not unexpected. The Sith are not friendly to your kind, but that will be an advantage, I think.
Slave. Welcome to my humble hole.
You are here for your trial, yes? Learn the ways of the Sith from a doddering old man in a tomb.
And hopefully to return to your master with the mark of my approval.
Yes, my lord. That's right.
As you say.
Of course it is. I know the way of things on the surface.
Hurry it up.
Don't worry, I wouldn't dare rob you of your precious time.
But before I answer either way--you must pass a trial of blood. Survive, and I will teach you what I know.
Actually, I just came to get some fresh air.
No, I do this for fun.
Do you take me for a fool? No one comes into these tombs for the sheer pleasure of it--not even me.
No, they come for power, because they sense that these tombs hold secrets of the dark side.
And they do--but before you can learn them, you must pass a trial of blood. Survive this, and I will teach you what I know.
Please, leave Spindrall to his rest.
